solution_line_template: Since there are four types of chocolate bars and each type has {bars_per_type} bars, the total number of chocolate bars is {bars_per_type}*{num_types}=<<{bars_per_type}*{num_types}={total_bars}>>{total_bars}.
Since there is a total of {percentage} chocolate bars and four types of chocolate, we divide {percentage}/{num_types}=<<{percentage}/{num_types}={percentage_per_type}>>{percentage_per_type}%.
